description: The round payoff this round was 107. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 107.

Choosing option 2 can be advantageous if the other player chooses option 1, as demonstrated by John receiving the full round payoff of 107 when Kate chose option 1. This suggests a structure where exploiting cooperation (by choosing 2) yields higher individual payoffs.

The game resembles a prisoner's dilemma, where mutual cooperation (both choosing 1) leads to higher collective payoffs, but unilateral defection (choosing 2) maximizes individual gain at the expense of the cooperator. This creates an incentive to defect if the other player cooperates.
